Noun is a word that describes a person, place, things

patterns: What are the types of nouns?
responses: There are 10 types of nouns: Common nouns, Proper nouns, Singular nouns, Plural nouns, Concrete nouns, Abstract nouns, Collective nouns, Compound nouns, Countable nouns, and Uncountable nouns.
Common nouns are words that refer to undefined or generic people, places, or things.

patterns: What are the examples of common nouns?
responses: Five examples of common nouns are: Man, Woman, Dog, Cat, Country
Proper nouns are words that help distinguish a specific person, place, or thing.
Proper nouns are words that refer to a specific person, place, or thing.

patterns: What are the examples of proper nouns?
responses: Five examples of proper nouns are names of a person, place, or thing like: Bob, Spain, Diary of a Wimpy Kid
Singular nouns are nouns that refer to only one person, place or thing.

patterns: What are the examples of singular nouns?
responses: Five examples of singular nouns are boat, house, cat, river
A plural noun are nouns that refer to more than one person, place, animal, thing, event, or idea.

patterns: What are the examples of plural nouns?
responses: Examples of plural nouns are: boats, houses, cats, dogs
A concrete noun is something that can be perceived through the five senses such as see, hear, touch, taste, or smell.
A abstract noun is something that cannot be perceived through the five senses such as see, hear, touch, taste, or smell.
A collective noun is a word that functions as a singular noun while referring to a group of people or things.
A compound noun combines two or more words into one but appears as a single word.
A countable noun is a word that you can count.
Known as Count Noun, it is a word that signifies counting.
A uncountable noun is a word that you can't count.
Known as Mass Noun, it is a word that you can't signifies counting.
A uncountable noun is a noun that expresses ownership.
An imperative sentence expresses a command, request, or instruction.
An exclamatory sentence expresses strong emotions or feelings. It is often used in greetings and warnings.
A paragraph is a group of sentences that talks about one main idea or topic.
Interjections are words used to express a sudden feeling.
A main point is the most important message of the paragraph or text.
A main point is what the selection is mostly about.
A main point is what is being talked about in the paragraph.
It is a complete sentence that includes the topic and what the author wants to say. However, the main idea may or may not stated
Supporting details are other facts or sentences that support or explain the main idea.
Supporting details are major details explain and develop the main idea.
Supporting details are minor details help make the major details clear.
A graphic organizer is a teaching and learning tool used to organize information and ideas that are easy to comprehend and internalize.

A graphic organizer is a visual display that organizes ideas and shows the relationship between concepts or information. It guides readers in thinking and helping them more to comprehend what they read.
Reference materials are books and other reading materials that help in researching or answering questions.

patterns: What are the examples of a reference material?
responses: Examples of reference materials are: Almanac, Encyclopedia, Index, Dictionary, Thesaurus ,Online resource/s
An almanac contains specific facts, statistical data, and other information related to people, places, events, etc.
An encyclopedia contains basic information about a broad range of topics and is arranged alphabetically. It usually comes in volumes.
An index contains information present in periodicals, books, newspapers, etc.
A dictionary contains words of a given language and provides the definition(s), spelling, pronunciation, and the origin of a particular word.
A thesaurus is a book full of synonyms including antonyms.

patterns: What are the different kinds of text types?
responses: There are 4 types of text: Narration, Information report, Argumentative, Procedural
This type of text narrates a story and entertains its readers. Stories and novels are examples of narration. A narration has basic elements such as characters, setting, and plot.

This type of text gives information about a person, place, or thing. It provides facts on a specific topic. This can be found in reference materials such as encyclopedias, reference books, technical texts, social studies books, science books, etc.
This type of text persuades readers to believe something. An argument is the writer’s reason as he/she is either 'for' or 'against' the issue.

This type of text follows a sequential order. It lists the materials to be used and the steps in a sequence. A procedural text is usually found in recipes, manuals and instructions that begin with a goal or title.
Prefixes are a group of letters added at the beginning of a word to change its meaning.
-re, -un, -de, -mis, -over, -under, -non, -bi, and tri
Suffixes are a group of letters added at the end of a word to change its meaning.
-ly, -ous, -ness, -er, -en, -ment, -able, -less, -ion and -tion
Explanation text is a text that describes how and why things work or happen.
Technical words are subject-specific words.They contain special meanings and are sometimes difficult to understand.
Context clues are clues found within a sentence, paragraph, or passage that a reader can be used to understand the meaning of new or unfamiliar words.

patterns: What are the types of context clues?
responses: The types of context clues are: Synonyms, Definition, Examples, Appositive
Synonyms are words that have the same meaning.
Definition is the word is defined directly in the sentence.
The word is further explained by a noun or group of words that come after it. It is usually separated by commas in the sentence.
The subject is who or what the sentence is all about.
Subject is who or what in a sentence. can be a noun, the name of a person, place, thing, or idea. It can be a subject pronoun like he, she, it, I, we, they, and you.
A verb is an action word being done by the subject in the sentence.

patterns: How do sentences in the natural order
responses: In the natural order, the subject comes first before the verb.

patterns: How do sentences in the inverted order
responses: In inverted order, the verb comes first before the subject. Most questions are in this order.
words are a sound or combination of sounds that has a meaning and is spoken or written.
are a group of two or more words that express a single idea but do not usually form a complete sentence.
Sentences are a word or a group of words that express a complete thought.

patterns: What is the function of the words and, but, and or?
responses: The words And, But, and Or connect some parts of the sentence.
The words And, But, and Or serves as a connector to parts of the sentence.
Conjunctions are words used to connect words, phrases, and sentences.

patterns: What does equal grammatical value mean?
responses: a word to another word
a phrase to another phrase
a sentence to another sentence

patterns: What are the seven coordinating conjunctions?
responses: The seven coordinating conjunctions are for, and, nor, but, or, yet, so.
for, and, nor, but, or, yet, so. FANBOYS for short
a sentence to another sentence
A clause is a group of words consisting of a subject and a predicate.

patterns: What are the types of clauses?
responses: There are two kinds of clauses: independent clause and dependent clause.
Independent clause is a group of words which has a complete thought and can stand alone.
Dependent clause is a group of words which needs to be attached to independent clauses for it to make sense.
Subordinating clauses are words used to introduce dependent clauses.
Cause is the source, origin, reason or action taken.
Effect is the desired outcome or expected result of the given cause.

patterns: What is the relationship between cause and effect?
responses: Cause-and-effect relationship can be express in complex sentences and compound sentences.
Compound sentence is a sentence made up of two independent clauses connected by a coordinating conjunction.
Complex sentences are sentences that made up of one independent clause and one dependent clause that begins with a subordinating conjunction.
A short story is a fictional work of prose that is shorter than a novel. It concentrates on one theme portrayed in a simple plot, often with a specific setting and few characters.
According to Edgar Allan Poe, a short story is a fictional work which must be read in one sitting only.

patterns: What are the elements of a short story?
responses: The elements of a short story are: Setting, Characters, Plot, Theme, and Point of View.
The setting refers to the time and place in which a story happened. It answers the questions when and where.
Characters refer to people, animals, or anything personified who plays a role in the story. They are considered to be the life of the story.

patterns: What is the different kinds of a character?
responses: Some stories have major/main characters, those whom thestory revolves around. Also, there are additional or support characters that make the story more interesting.

patterns: What are different types of major characters?
responses: There have 2 types of major characters: these are the Protagonist and the antagonist.
The protagonist is the leading character to whom the story revolves usually good-natured but sometimes flawed.
The antagonist is the opposite or goes against the protagonist usually portrayed as the bad guy and sometimes causes the conflict.
The plot pertains to the series of events in the story. These events are related to each other and help unfold the story.

patterns: What is the flow of a plot?
responses: The plot flows from Beginning action/exposition, Rising action, Climax, Falling action, Resolution or ending.
The theme refers to the central idea or belief presented by the author in the story.

patterns: What is a point of view?
responses: The point of view of a story determines who is telling it and the narrator's relationship to the characters in the story.

patterns: What are different points of view?
responses: The point of view has 3 different points: First person, Second person, and Third person.

patterns: What is a first person point of view?
responses: The first person point of view is the narrator is a person in the story, telling the story from their own perspective.

patterns: What is a second person point of view?
responses: The second person point of view is the reader is part of the story.
The second person point of view is the The narrator describes the reader's actions, thoughts, and background of the story.

patterns: What is a third person point of view?
responses: The narrator exists outside the events of the story, and relates the actions of the characters by referring to their names or by the third-person pronouns he, she, or they.

patterns: How would I know if the story is a reality?
How would I know if the story based on real life?
responses: Stories can be considered reality if they talk about facts, historical events, and real-life scenarios.

patterns: How would I know if the story is a make believe?
How would I know if the story based on fiction?
responses: A story is make-believe if it deals with fictional characters, events, and/or settings.
Tense refers to the time indicated by the verb.
Tense refers to the time indicated by the verb.
Past tense indicates that the action is already done.
Present tense indicates that the action is being done at the moment.
Future tense indicates that the action will be done in the future.
An informational text is a nonfiction writing that aims to provide information to the readers about a certain topic.
A descriptive text is a type of informational text that gives thorough details about a particular topic.
